unnormalised: ## My Data Pack's Crying: A Hilarious Take on Music Streaming
normalised: Arey yaar, remember the good old days? Cassettes tangled like Diwali lights, radio jingles stuck in your head for days, and buying C D's that cost more than a plate of butter chicken at Moti Mahal? Those were the days of limited choice, but unlimited patience. Now? We're drowning in an ocean of music thanks to streaming services, and frankly, my data pack is having an existential crisis.

unnormalised: Arey yaar, remember the good ol' days? Cassettes tangled like Diwali lights, radio jingles stuck in your head for days, and buying CDs that cost more than a plate of butter chicken at Moti Mahal? Those were the days of limited choice, but unlimited patience. Now? We're drowning in an ocean of music thanks to streaming services, and frankly, my data pack is having an existential crisis.
normalised: Seriously, I think my phone weeps in binary code every time I hit "play" on Spotify. I mean, one song probably costs more data than an entire Govinda movie used to back in the nineties. And let’s not even TALK about high-definition audio. My phone's processor probably starts humming like a malfunctioning auto-rickshaw trying to climb a flyover in Mumbai.

unnormalised: Seriously, I think my phone weeps in binary code every time I hit "play" on Spotify. I mean, *one song* probably costs more data than an entire Govinda movie used to back in the 90s. And let’s not even TALK about high-definition audio. My phone's processor probably starts humming like a malfunctioning auto-rickshaw trying to climb a flyover in Mumbai.
normalised: My cousin, Priya, bless her soul, listens to Carnatic classical music all day long. She's probably single-handedly keeping Jio in business. And then there's Rohan, who exclusively streams Bollywood remixes. I suspect he thinks he's starring in his own personal Dharma Productions movie. He even started wearing a leather jacket in Bangalore. In May.

unnormalised: My cousin, Priya, bless her soul, listens to Carnatic classical music *all day long*. She's probably single-handedly keeping Jio in business. And then there's Rohan, who exclusively streams Bollywood remixes. I suspect he thinks he's starring in his own personal Dharma Productions movie. He even started wearing a leather jacket in Bangalore. In May.
normalised: But hey, who am I to judge? I spend half my day listening to old Kishore Kumar songs while pretending to work. It's a vicious cycle, really. I need music to focus, but then I end up dancing in my chair and spilling chai on my keyboard. The struggle is real, my friends.

unnormalised: But hey, who am I to judge? I spend half my day listening to old Kishore Kumar songs while pretending to work. It's a vicious cycle, really. I need music to focus, but then I end up dancing in my chair and spilling chai on my keyboard. The struggle is real, my friends.
normalised: So, what’s the solution? Maybe we all need to go back to listening to C D's and tapes. Nah, just kidding! My data pack might cry, but my ears are singing. Just gotta budget those precious G B's wisely. Maybe lay off the YouTube cat videos for a week. Maybe. Or maybe I’ll just ask Priya for her Jio hotspot password. Don't tell her I said that. And definitely don't tell Rohan. He'll start streaming his remixes even louder. God help us all.
